# Introduction

This analysis uses data from the Iowa neonic study and compares it to ToxCast endpoints to evaluate potential for adverse bio-effect by neonics

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
options(continue=" ")
options(width=100)
library(pander)
library(dplyr)
library(reshape2)
library(DT)
library(toxEval)
library(knitr)

sites <- c("0545510","0541210","05418400","06604440","05418600","06810000","05465500","05420500","06610000")
clothMax <- c(257,38,73.8,6.3,13.2,59.9,78.8,12.7,25.9)
clothMedian <- c(17.1,9.2,4.6,2,3.8,2.7,12.6,3.8,3.9)
temp <- as.data.frame(rbind(clothMax,clothMedian))

names(temp) <- sites
neonicData <- temp
neonicData$casn <- "210880-92-5"

endPointInfo <- endPointInfo
# AC50 data provided in the toxEval package:
AC50gain <- AC50gain
packagePath <- system.file("extdata", package="toxEval")
#Site Info:
neonicCAS <- read.csv("neonicCAS.csv")

#parameter info:
neonicCAS$class <- "Neonicotinoids"

neonicData <- left_join(neonicData, neonicCAS, by=c("CAS"))
t(neonicData[,2:3])

neonicData <- neonicData[!duplicated(neonicData$CAS),]
neonicData$class[neonicData$Chemical == "Hexachlorobenzene (HCB)"] <-"OC Pesticides"
neonicData$class[neonicData$Chemical == "Pentachloroanisole (PCA)"] <-"OC Pesticides"
neonicData$class[is.na(neonicData$class)] <-"Pharmaceuticals"

neonicData <- neonicData[,-which(names(neonicData) == "site04249000.1")]

head(neonicData[,1:7])

```
